Thanks Ahmed for the very good pointer :)I have chosen the groovy script fo=
r seeing the pending urls .Currently I am running it from an windowsand its=
 working fine as I can =C2=A0see the pending URL's,I guess it works fine on=
 linux as well ?

Sandip 

     On Wednesday, 4 March 2015 12:52 AM, "Ahmed=
 Alsum aalsum@... [archive-crawler]" <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.=
com> wrote:
   

 =C2=A0   Hi Sandip,
You can use the job console (it is a =
link on the top-right handside in the job detailed page) to run some script=
s to retrieve/modify the frontier.
These two links have a large set of scri=
pts that you can use.
https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Her=
itrix3+Useful+Scriptshttps://github.com/ukwa/monitrix/tree/master/monitrix-=
webapp/app/scripts
Regards,Ahmed
From:  Archive Crawler <archive-crawler@ya=
hoogroups.com>
Reply-To:  Archive Crawler <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>=

Date:  Tuesday, March 3, 2015 at 11:06 AM
To:  Archive Crawler <archive-cr=
awler@yahoogroups.com>
Subject:  [archive-crawler] Queued URIs

 =C2=A0  Hi=
,My job hangs with about 30 URI's still in queue .How do I find out which U=
RI's are still pending =C2=A0to be crawled ?I looked at the FrontierSummary=
 and found some 15 SNOOZED queues and 15 LONGEST queues.What do these mean =
? I can see both of them add to 30 same as my queued URI's :)=C2=A0
Also in=
 the snoozed queues I find something like "dns:keydown.tt" =C2=A0does this =
mean some dns look up is failing which is resulting i n this queue up ?
Is =
there any way to find why the Job hangs ?

ThanksSandip    #yiv2483049672 #=
